DataElement.preferredName: Patient Investigational Clinical Trial Current Participation Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to whether the current utilization of medical treatments or other interventions prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Investigational Clinical Trial Current Participation Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the current participation in a of research study that tests how well new or experimental medical treatments or other interventions as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Investigational Clinical Trial Current Participation Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: In the process of being studied; experimental.  (NCI):A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.:Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Taking part in an activity.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: In the process of being studied; experimental.

A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical study.
Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
The act of taking part in an activity.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Currently receiving treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Currently receiving treatment in a different clinical study in which investigational procedures are performed or investigational therapies are administered

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Receiving any other investigational agent which would be considered as a treatment for the primary neoplasm

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving any investigational agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient used any investigational product within the past 30 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Receiving any other investigational agent concurrently which would be considered as a treatment for the primary neoplasm

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Planned cytotoxic chemotherapy during the SRS and WBRT

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any other investigational agent(s)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Planned cytotoxic chemotherapy during WBRT only

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient used any investigational product within the past 4 weeks

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving another investigational drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient used any investigational product within 4 weeks prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1802 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any other standard or investigational agent(s)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Planned cytotoxic chemotherapy on the same day as SRS or HA-WBRT

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient used any investigational product within 4 weeks prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Planned administration of cytotoxic chemotherapy or tyrosine/multi-kinase inhibitors within the 3 days prior to, the day of, or within 3 days after the completion of SRS.
